adjective.description: Of a bright red, reddish-purple, or reddish-yellow colour or shade.

origin: Late Middle English; earliest use found in John Trevisa (c1342–?1402), translator. From classical Latin pūniceus bright red, scarlet, crimson (from Pūnicus + -eus, partly after purpureus purple, and partly after ancient Greek ϕοινίκεος: see phoeniceous) + -ous. Compare Spanish † puniceo, Italian puniceo.
